div.div: returns TRUE if all the arguments evaluate to TRUE. FALSE is returned if one or more arguments is FALSE.

div.span: a logical expression that is either TRUE or FALSE.

div.p: for more information see the wikipedia article on boolean logic.

div.div: returns TRUE if one or more of the arguments evaluate to TRUE. FALSE is only returned if all arguments are FALSE.

div.span: a logical expression that is either TRUE or FALSE.

div.p: for more information see the wikipedia article on boolean logic.

div.div: returns the opposite logical value of the specified value.

div.span: an expression that is either TRUE or FALSE.

div.div: IF returns the true_value if logical_test is True and false_value if logical_test is False.

div.span: an expression that evalutes to TRUE or FALSE
the value that is returned if logical_test is TRUE
the value that is returned if logical_test is FALSE. if false_value is not present then 0 is returned.

div.p: for more information see the wikipedia article on boolean logic.
